text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm gorov a senior technical
account manager here at AWS office in
gurugram India today I'm going to show
you how to configure Amazon simple email
service SC and Amazon simple
notification service SNS to receive
domain validation emails let's get
started sometimes when you request a
certificate from AWS certificate manager
ACM you might not get an email to
validate the domain this happens for one
of the two reasons either you do not
have a DNS MX record configured for the
domain or the registar doesn't support
domain email
forwarding let's see how to resolve this
problem after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the SNS
dashboard expand the menu on the left
and then choose topics choose the orange
button on the right to open a new window
for this SNS topic choose standard type
next enter the topic name and display
name let's navigate further note that
you can keep the optional features as
they are SNS offers Security Options
that you can use to turn on encryption
Define access policy and view the newly
launched archival policy
logs and tags are optional yet useful
features along with tracking you are
ready to create the topic by choosing
the
button after you create the topic create
a subscription choose the create
subscription button in the visit choose
email as the protocol and then provide
an email that can subscribe to this
topic your inbox will receive an email
with a confirmation link open the link
to subscribe
next we will go to Amazon
SE navigate to the verified
identities and select create
identity choose domain as the identity
type then provide a domain name here
this domain also must be verified so
choose a method to verify your domain if
your domain isn't hosted with Amazon
Route 53 you can manually add the
records to your
domain note if your domain is registered
with Route 53 Amazon sces automatically
updates your domain's DNS server with
the necessary records to turn off this
automatic update first expand the
advanced tkim settings and then uncheck
publish DNS records to Route 15 3 in the
easy dkim
selection next provide an optional tag
and choose create identity domain
validation can take up to 72
hours now let's go to Route 53 to view
our hostage Zone record
set navigate to hosted
zones and then add an entry to the
MX record with the iy of
10 navigate back to Amazon
SE and choose email
receiving next choose create rule set
enter a unique name to the rule and then
choose create rule set enter its name
choose next and then add a new recipient
condition add one of the five email
owners that that are associated with the
domain Amazon sces can only receive
email on your behalf for domains that
you own any email address that you
specify as a recipient condition must
belong to a verified domain identity for
this example admin at theate domain was
selected next for add actions we will
add two actions the first action is
publish to to Amazon SNS topic for the
SNS topic let's select the SNS topic
that was created earlier also make sure
that the encoding is set to
utf8 for second action let's choose stop
rule
set and choose
next on the review screen check your
work and then choose create
role next we will need to make sure that
this rule set is active navigate to the
rule set and make it
active now we are all set to send the
AWS certificate manager validation email
for this let's navigate to
ACM if we don't already have a pending
certificate validation we will create
the public facing certificate and then
choose the email validation
method this sends an email to The Chosen
email address under the domain make sure
to choose the same email address that
was configured in the previous
step if there is an existing pending
certificate validation let's choose the
certificate and go to details then
navigate to domains and finally let's
choose recent validation email
email you will get an email validation
for domain from Amazon SES email re
notification open the validation link
hit I
approve refresh your ACM certificate
screen to see that your certificate is
validated and now you know how to
configure Amazon sces and Amazon SNS to
receive domain validation emails thanks
for watching and happy cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
